member.name: WS_ERROR_PROPERTY_ID
member.summary: A set of property values associated with the error. They are set and retrieved using and.

summary.para: The number of error strings (ULONG) available in the error object. Error strings might be added using . When is present in the error object, the corresponding error text will be counted as an additional string in the returned number of error strings.
If the error returned from the function was mapped to one of the standard WS_E_* errors, then this property is used to store the original implementation specific error code.

Note that the original error code is specific to a particular implementation and version of the underlying libraries used by WWSAPI. It should not be expected to remain constant, as the libraries may change.
The main purpose in exposing this error is for diagnostic purposes, as the application may take a look at original error code of underlying library that caused this error.
Applications that take specific action based on the implementation specific error code will likely be broken when the implementation changes.
If the error was not mapped from an implementation specific value to a standard error, then this property will have the value NOERROR.
This identifies the language of any language sensitive information in the error object.
This value may not be zero.
This value may only be set when the error object is first created, or after it has been reset using .
